alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:22AM CDT until July 26 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Woods and Major Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet this evening. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM CDT.
